user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_PriorityRemap:
```c
static int OS_PriorityRemap(osal_priority_t InputPri)
{
    int OutputPri;

    if (InputPri == 0)
    {
        /* use the "MAX" local priority only for OSAL tasks with priority=0 */
        OutputPri = POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMax;
    }
    else if (InputPri >= OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY)
    {
        /* use the "MIN" local priority only for OSAL tasks with priority=255 */
        OutputPri = POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMin;
    }
    else
    {
        /*
         * Spread the remainder of OSAL priorities over the remainder of local priorities
         *
         * Note OSAL priorities use the VxWorks style with zero being the
         * highest and OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY being the lowest, this inverts it
         */
        OutputPri = (OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY - 1) - (int)InputPri;

        OutputPri *= (POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMax - POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMin) - 2;
        OutputPri += OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY / 2;
        OutputPri /= (OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY - 2);
        OutputPri += POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMin + 1;
    }

    return OutputPri;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code fragment modifies the function parameter InputPri. The parameter is only read in comparisons and expressions (if (InputPri == 0), else if (InputPri >= ...), and in the arithmetic expression where it is cast to int: (int)InputPri). There are no assignments to InputPri and no pointer parameters in this function (so the pointer-related part of Rule 17.8 is not applicable). All assignments are to the local variable OutputPri or to/from global read-only fields; thus no violation of "a function parameter should not be modified" is present in the provided code.
